Satoshi Nakamoto is a pseudonym—like a pen name—for the unknown person or group who invented Bitcoin in 2008.<[silence:2400]
Most people think of Bitcoin as digital money.<[silence:1200]> But Nakamoto’s real breakthrough was solving a problem called double-spending—stopping someone from copying and reusing the same digital coin.<[silence:2400]
Imagine sending a photo to a friend.<[silence:1200]> You still have the original, and so do they.<[silence:1200]> Nakamoto’s system works like a public ledger—everyone can see every transaction, so no one can cheat.<[silence:2400]
